response.answer_text: Answering after a year , now with lot more details and experience😉 Starting with Campus Size of Campus :- 100 acresIt's huge as compared to all the new medical college as well as some old one's too. In all the new medical colleges of UP , GMC BADAUN and GIMS NOIDA have their In Patient Departments, Outpatient Departments and 24×7 emergency facilities in the Campus itself , while other newly built colleges have “college campus at different location and Hospital at different location”. You will realise it's worth during clinical postings from 2nd yearGMC Badaun is just 1 hr distance from Bareilly , 5–6 hrs distance from Delhi, 5 hr distance from Nainital , 5 hr distance from Agra & Mathura etc. So it's quite easy to travel from here ( for short trips or visiting home)You can easily get transport facilities just outside Campus itself like AC or Normal buses to Major cities .Cafeteria , and a small tea stall is located inside the campus (open till 7–8pm)Many tea stalls and A Dhaba are just outside the campus open throughout the day and night.There are Many Security guards 24×7 In the campus itself.Girls and Boys hostel have their own security guards 24×7.Police vehicles takes round of campus 2–3 times in night . ( Don't roam in campus in night )Academic Block Construction in Almost on verge of completion ( last time i had seen my campus was just before lockdown but I have heard a lot of work has been done there.)Academic block is of 7 or 8 floors ( I don't remember correctly) with Lift facilities and 4 stairs.All the labs of 1st and 2nd year are totally ready and for rest year it will progress as per demandSince College is new , all the infrastructure , equipment and other facilities are latest one.Demo rooms , Locker rooms, Dissection hall, Lecture Theatres are well built. (In LTs you can easily hide and take nap)College don't have Biometric attandance system ( quite lucky because we can easily mark the proxy )Each floor has it's own water cooler with RO and Washroom facilities.Hostels Girls and Boys Hostels are well built .24×7 security guardsIn hostel messDouble seated Rooms with separate balcony for each room.( Very lucky to have balconies )Large Common room for discussions and other works.Washrooms on each floor24×7 water and electricity supplyGirls hostel has boundry wall with gate and security cameras for the safety.Spacious grounds for Vollywoll , Badminton , Cricket , Table tennis.Teaching Faculty and Facilities Most of the Professor have a lot of experience in teaching in some of the prestigious colleges like AMU , PGIMS , SMS , LLRM , GSVM etc.Some of the Professors have teaching experience of 40+ years .Each department has Professors , Associate Professors, Assistant Professors, Tutors , JRs , LTs and other staffs in short Complete Faculty as per Recommend rules.(Some of the established college also don't have full Faculties)College have One Central Library and each Department has it's own library too.All the teaching and non-teaching staff are friendly.( If you act rude with themyou have to wear the consequences)Some photos  Entry Gate  Academic Block  Boys Hostel from A Distance  Our Gol chakkar or PMC( you will get to know its meaning after spending some time in College 😉)     Bonfire night students and Faculty members  Indoor games   Pot painting competition  CHC visit during foundation course  Holi Celebration  Group pic of during College Fest  Hostel  Sports fest inauguration  After live Conference With Our CM These are some of the pictures Thank you 😊

Hello, I have been alloted GMC BADAUN in my state first counselling. I visited there so the institution is still under construction though it has been completed for first year students and also for there next year. Hospital is also not fully completed OPD is working with fair amount of load. Trauma centre is under construction. Faculty here is good and looks promising. Campus is approx 5 km away from city. Now acc. to me it will still require atleast two years to get completed in major aspects. It can be a good choice if u are going for new GMCs. Thanks.
